# Create the SALT MVP project structure and files, then zip it up for the user.
import os, textwrap, json, zipfile, pathlib, io, sys

base = "/mnt/data/salt_mvp"
backend_dir = os.path.join(base, "backend", "app")
routers_dir = os.path.join(backend_dir, "routers")
frontend_dir = os.path.join(base, "frontend")

os.makedirs(routers_dir, exist_ok=True)
os.makedirs(frontend_dir, exist_ok=True)

main_py = textwrap.dedent("""
from fastapi import FastAPI
from fastapi.middleware.cors import CORSMiddleware
from .routers import reports, alerts, kyr

app = FastAPI(
    title="SALT API",
    version="0.1.0",
    description=\"\"\"
SALT (Safety, Alerts, Language, Tools)  MVP API

Core concepts:
- Anonymous/community reports (optionally signed-in)
- Real-time/geofenced alerts
- Know-Your-Rights (KYR) content, multilingual
- Language access pipeline with glossary hooks
- Privacy-first by design
\"\"\"
)

# CORS for local dev; tighten in production
app.add_middleware(
    CORSMiddleware,
    allow_origins=["*"],
    allow_credentials=True,
    allow_methods=["*"],
    allow_headers=["*"],
)

app.include_router(reports.router, prefix="/reports", tags=["reports"])
app.include_router(alerts.router, prefix="/alerts", tags=["alerts"])
app.include_router(kyr.router, prefix="/kyr", tags=["kyr"])

@app.get("/", tags=["meta"])
def root():
    return {"ok": True, "name": "SALT API", "version": "0.1.0"}
""")

db_py = textwrap.dedent("""
from sqlmodel import SQLModel, create_engine, Session
import os

DATABASE_URL = os.getenv("DATABASE_URL", "sqlite:///./salt.db")
engine = create_engine(DATABASE_URL, echo=False)

def init_db():
    from .models import Report, Alert, KYRItem
    SQLModel.metadata.create_all(engine)

def get_session():
    with Session(engine) as session:
        yield session
""")

models_py = textwrap.dedent("""
from datetime import datetime
from typing import Optional, List
from sqlmodel import SQLModel, Field, Relationship

class Report(SQLModel, table=True):
    id: Optional[int] = Field(default=None, primary_key=True)
    created_at: datetime = Field(default_factory=datetime.utcnow, index=True)
    # Optional user context
    contact_email: Optional[str] = Field(default=None)
    # Location (lat/lng) and radius for geofencing
    latitude: Optional[float] = Field(default=None, index=True)
    longitude: Optional[float] = Field(default=None, index=True)
    radius_m: Optional[int] = Field(default=None, description="Approximate radius of relevance in meters")
    # Event details
    category: str = Field(index=True, description="e.g., 'checkpoint', 'raid', 'sighting', 'resource'")
    description: str
    language: Optional[str] = Field(default="en")
    is_verified: bool = Field(default=False, index=True)

class Alert(SQLModel, table=True):
    id: Optional[int] = Field(default=None, primary_key=True)
    created_at: datetime = Field(default_factory=datetime.utcnow, index=True)
    title: str
    message: str
    language: Optional[str] = Field(default="en")
    latitude: Optional[float] = Field(default=None, index=True)
    longitude: Optional[float] = Field(default=None, index=True)
    radius_m: Optional[int] = Field(default=1000)

class KYRItem(SQLModel, table=True):
    id: Optional[int] = Field(default=None, primary_key=True)
    slug: str = Field(index=True, unique=True)
    title: str
    body_markdown: str
    language: str = Field(default="en", index=True)
    jurisdiction: Optional[str] = Field(default=None, index=True)  # e.g., 'US-CA'
    version: str = Field(default="1.0")
    updated_at: datetime = Field(default_factory=datetime.utcnow, index=True)
""")

schemas_py = textwrap.dedent("""
from typing import Optional, List
from pydantic import BaseModel, Field

class GeoQuery(BaseModel):
    latitude: float
    longitude: float
    radius_m: int = Field(default=1000, ge=10, le=100000)

class ReportCreate(BaseModel):
    contact_email: Optional[str] = None
    latitude: Optional[float] = None
    longitude: Optional[float] = None
    radius_m: Optional[int] = 500
    category: str
    description: str
    language: Optional[str] = "en"

class ReportRead(BaseModel):
    id: int
    category: str
    description: str
    language: Optional[str]
    latitude: Optional[float]
    longitude: Optional[float]
    radius_m: Optional[int]

class AlertCreate(BaseModel):
    title: str
    message: str
    language: Optional[str] = "en"
    latitude: Optional[float] = None
    longitude: Optional[float] = None
    radius_m: Optional[int] = 1000

class AlertRead(BaseModel):
    id: int
    title: str
    message: str
    language: Optional[str]
    latitude: Optional[float]
    longitude: Optional[float]
    radius_m: Optional[int]

class KYRCreate(BaseModel):
    slug: str
    title: str
    body_markdown: str
    language: str = "en"
    jurisdiction: Optional[str] = None
    version: Optional[str] = "1.0"

class KYRRead(BaseModel):
    id: int
    slug: str
    title: str
    body_markdown: str
    language: str
    jurisdiction: Optional[str]
    version: str
""")

reports_router = textwrap.dedent("""
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException
from sqlmodel import select
from ..db import get_session
from ..models import Report
from ..schemas import ReportCreate, ReportRead, GeoQuery
from sqlmodel import Session
from typing import List
from math import radians, cos, sin, asin, sqrt

router = APIRouter()

def haversine(lat1, lon1, lat2, lon2):
    # Earth radius in meters
    R = 6371000
    phi1, phi2 = radians(lat1), radians(lat2)
    dphi = radians(lat2 - lat1)
    dlambda = radians(lon2 - lon1)
    a = sin(dphi/2)**2 + cos(phi1) * cos(phi2) * sin(dlambda/2)**2
    c = 2 * asin(sqrt(a))
    return R * c

@router.post("/", response_model=ReportRead)
def create_report(payload: ReportCreate, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    item = Report(
        contact_email=payload.contact_email,
        latitude=payload.latitude,
        longitude=payload.longitude,
        radius_m=payload.radius_m,
        category=payload.category,
        description=payload.description,
        language=payload.language,
    )
    session.add(item)
    session.commit()
    session.refresh(item)
    return ReportRead(
        id=item.id, category=item.category, description=item.description,
        language=item.language, latitude=item.latitude, longitude=item.longitude,
        radius_m=item.radius_m
    )

@router.get("/", response_model=List[ReportRead])
def list_reports(session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    results = session.exec(select(Report).order_by(Report.id.desc())).all()
    return [ReportRead(
        id=i.id, category=i.category, description=i.description, language=i.language,
        latitude=i.latitude, longitude=i.longitude, radius_m=i.radius_m
    ) for i in results]

@router.post("/nearby", response_model=List[ReportRead])
def list_reports_nearby(q: GeoQuery, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    results = session.exec(select(Report)).all()
    out = []
    for i in results:
        if i.latitude is not None and i.longitude is not None:
            d = haversine(q.latitude, q.longitude, i.latitude, i.longitude)
            if d <= q.radius_m + (i.radius_m or 0):
                out.append(i)
    out.sort(key=lambda x: x.id, reverse=True)
    return [ReportRead(
        id=i.id, category=i.category, description=i.description, language=i.language,
        latitude=i.latitude, longitude=i.longitude, radius_m=i.radius_m
    ) for i in out]
""")

alerts_router = textwrap.dedent("""
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends
from sqlmodel import select
from ..db import get_session
from ..models import Alert
from ..schemas import AlertCreate, AlertRead, GeoQuery
from sqlmodel import Session
from typing import List
from math import radians, cos, sin, asin, sqrt

router = APIRouter()

def haversine(lat1, lon1, lat2, lon2):
    R = 6371000
    phi1, phi2 = radians(lat1), radians(lat2)
    dphi = radians(lat2 - lat1)
    dlambda = radians(lon2 - lon1)
    a = sin(dphi/2)**2 + cos(phi1) * cos(phi2) * sin(dlambda/2)**2
    c = 2 * asin(sqrt(a))
    return R * c

@router.post("/", response_model=AlertRead)
def create_alert(payload: AlertCreate, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    item = Alert(**payload.dict())
    session.add(item)
    session.commit()
    session.refresh(item)
    return AlertRead(
        id=item.id, title=item.title, message=item.message, language=item.language,
        latitude=item.latitude, longitude=item.longitude, radius_m=item.radius_m
    )

@router.get("/", response_model=List[AlertRead])
def list_alerts(session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    results = session.exec(select(Alert).order_by(Alert.id.desc())).all()
    return [AlertRead(
        id=i.id, title=i.title, message=i.message, language=i.language,
        latitude=i.latitude, longitude=i.longitude, radius_m=i.radius_m
    ) for i in results]

@router.post("/nearby", response_model=List[AlertRead])
def list_alerts_nearby(q: GeoQuery, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    results = session.exec(select(Alert)).all()
    out = []
    for i in results:
        if i.latitude is not None and i.longitude is not None:
            d = haversine(q.latitude, q.longitude, i.latitude, i.longitude)
            if d <= q.radius_m + (i.radius_m or 0):
                out.append(i)
    out.sort(key=lambda x: x.id, reverse=True)
    return [AlertRead(
        id=i.id, title=i.title, message=i.message, language=i.language,
        latitude=i.latitude, longitude=i.longitude, radius_m=i.radius_m
    ) for i in out]
""")

kyr_router = textwrap.dedent("""
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException
from sqlmodel import select
from ..db import get_session
from ..models import KYRItem
from ..schemas import KYRCreate, KYRRead
from sqlmodel import Session
from typing import List

router = APIRouter()

@router.post("/", response_model=KYRRead)
def create_kyr(payload: KYRCreate, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    existing = session.exec(select(KYRItem).where(KYRItem.slug == payload.slug, KYRItem.language == payload.language)).first()
    if existing:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=409, detail="KYR item already exists for this slug/language")
    item = KYRItem(**payload.dict())
    session.add(item)
    session.commit()
    session.refresh(item)
    return KYRRead(**item.dict())

@router.get("/", response_model=List[KYRRead])
def list_kyr(language: str = "en", session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    results = session.exec(select(KYRItem).where(KYRItem.language == language).order_by(KYRItem.updated_at.desc())).all()
    return [KYRRead(**i.dict()) for i in results]

@router.get("/{slug}", response_model=KYRRead)
def get_kyr(slug: str, language: str = "en", session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    item = session.exec(select(KYRItem).where(KYRItem.slug == slug, KYRItem.language == language)).first()
    if not item:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Not found")
    return KYRRead(**item.dict())
""")

pydantic==2.8.2

readme_backend = textwrap.dedent("""
# SALT API (MVP)

A privacy-first backend for the SALT system (Safety, Alerts, Language, Tools).

## Quickstart (local)

1) Create venv and install deps:

```bash
python3 -m venv .venv && source .venv/bin/activate
pip install -r requirements.txt

  1. Run the API:

bash
export DATABASE_URL=sqlite:///./salt.db  # optional; defaults to sqlite
python -c "from app.db import init_db; init_db()"
uvicorn app.main:app --reload

Open http://127.0.0.1:8000/docs for Swagger UI.

Endpoints

  • POST /reports/ create report

  • GET /reports/ list

  • POST /reports/nearby list reports by geofence (lat/lng + radius)

  • POST /alerts/ create alert

  • GET /alerts/ list alerts

  • POST /alerts/nearby list alerts by geofence

  • POST /kyr/ create KYR item (slug, language)

  • GET /kyr/?language=en list KYR in a language

  • GET /kyr/{slug}?language=en fetch one item

Notes

  • Uses SQLite for demo; switch DATABASE_URL to Postgres for production.

  • Add auth/RBAC via an API gateway or FastAPI dependencies.

  • Consider PostGIS for advanced geospatial.

  • Never store sensitive PII. Minimize data retention.
    """)

env_example = textwrap.dedent("""

DATABASE_URL=postgresql+psycopg2://user:pass@localhost:5432/salt

For dev the default SQLite is fine.

""")

How this maps to your original SALT vision

  • Trust & verification: baseline is open community reporting; roadmap adds signed posts from verified partner orgs and moderation cues.

  • Multi-channel: web/PWA now; SMS/WhatsApp/Telegram connectors next for communities that need low-data or non-app access.

Project Salt Ethics & Trauma-Informed UX (Claude Track) v1

Core UX Principles

  • Safety first, always: Minimize risk by default; no PII required; graceful degradation (works with SMS-only).

  • Trauma-informed: Lower cognitive load, give agency, avoid coercion, and provide clear exits.

  • Plain language & multilingual: Target ~6th8th grade reading level; English/Spanish baseline, expandable.

  • Transparency: What you collect, why, how long; consent is granular and reversible.

  • Accountability without gatekeeping: Community-led moderation with verifiable process, not opaque veto power.

Crisis & De-Escalation Flows

1) Panic-State Detection Calm UI

Triggers (any):

  • User taps a Panic button, or types a keyword via SMS (e.g., PANIC).

  • UI signal: rapid taps, form abandonments, or Help now.

Immediate changes:

  • Switch to high-contrast, minimal UI (single action per screen).

  • Offer 3 choices only: Call/Hotline, See Rights, Send Silent Check-In.

  • Mute animations; enlarge buttons; reduce text to one sentence per screen.

Microcopy (examples):

  • Youre safe here. Choose one action.

  • No personal info needed.

Tech notes (for DeepSeek):

  • Panic route served from local cache (PWA), no network dependency.

  • Low-bandwidth SMS fallback returns 160-char rights script + hotline.

2) Quick-Exit & Cover

  • 2-tap exit to a neutral screen (e.g., weather).

  • Auto-clear recent page from in-app history.

  • Optional decoy PIN to open a safe-looking cover section.

3) De-Escalation Messaging

  • Avoid sensational terms; focus on concrete choices: Wait inside, Call organizer, Document from a safe distanceonly if lawful.

Consent & Data Minimization

Progressive Disclosure

  • Tier 0 (default): No account, no PII, ephemeral session.

  • Tier 1 (optional): Pseudonymous handle or trusted-reporter voucher.

  • Tier 2 (org): Verified org signature for broadcast alerts.

Granular Fields

  • Location: fuzzy radius options (100m/500m/1km) or neighborhood only.

  • Time: now, within 30 min, earlier today, yesterday.

  • Evidence: text or media optional; strip metadata client-side; redact faces by default.

Retention Defaults

  • Reports: unverified entries auto-expire (e.g., 2472h) unless confirmed.

  • Logs: minimize and rotate; store only whats needed for safety/audit.

Reporting & Verification (Without Doxxing)

Three Lanes

  1. Anonymous (default): limited reach; requires mod review before map display.

  2. Trusted Reporter (community-vouched): wider reach; soft moderation.

  3. Verified Org (signed): highest reach; can push geo-alerts with cooldowns.

Triage Decision Tree

  • Content fit? (enforcement, checkpoint, detention, resource) else General tip.

  • Risk check: do not post exact addresses if it endangers individuals; prefer intersections or zones.

  • Duplicate detection: same time/zone cluster, not amplify.

  • Harm filter: remove personal names/plates unless explicit, lawful reasons exist (and policy allows).

Rate Limiting & Dampers

  • Per-zone cooldowns; first reports require corroboration before heatmap intensifies.

  • Rumor label for unverified; visually distinct from Verified.

Community Moderation Protocols

Roles: Moderator, Coordinator, Language Liaison, Legal Liaison.
SLA: Acknowledge within 10 min (high-risk), 60 min (normal).
Escalations: Swatting/targeting auto-lock + notify coordinators.
Restorative approach: Misinfo educate; repeat abuse shadow-limit or block.

Audit trail (privacy-preserving):

  • Every decision gets: timestamp, category, action (approve/merge/reject/soft-post), reason code.

  • Exportable weekly for community review (with sensitive bits removed).

Language Access & Cultural Responsiveness

  • Pipeline: Source MT draft Human review Publish.

  • Glossary: Rights/legal terms with culturally appropriate equivalents; avoid false friends.

  • Style: Short sentences, active voice, avoid idioms.

  • Fallback: If translation missing, display English + Tap for phone interpreter (where available).

  • Local variants: Spanish (US) vs regional phrasing toggles; community-tunable.

Safety-by-Design (Threat Highlights)

  • Device safety: PWA offline cache for KYR; panic assets stored locally; clear local data button.

  • Metadata shredding: Strip EXIF/creation times; blur faces/license plates by default.

  • Geo-privacy: Snap locations to grid; never store raw GPS without consent.

  • Channel hygiene: SMS has higher risk; limit sensitive payloads, use codewords opt-in.

  • Abuse vectors: Brigading, false flags, doxxing rate limits, voucher limits, moderated first-post.

Important: The tool must never be used to facilitate evasion of lawful processes or obstruct justice. It focuses on legal rights education, safety information, and community support. All features must comply with applicable laws and platform policies.

Legal & Ethical Guardrails (High-Level)

  • Terms/Use: Prohibit targeting individuals; prohibit doxxing; define acceptable content.

  • LE requests process: Publish policy; require lawful requests; narrow scope; notify users when allowed.

  • Mandated reporting: Clarify when staff must escalate (e.g., credible imminent harm).

  • Data governance: Minimal collection; retention schedules; role-based access; encryption in transit/at rest.

  • Jurisdictional notes: Different states have differing recording/location privacy lawsUI should provide localized guidance without giving legal advice.

Risk Register (Sample)

RiskImpactLikelihoodMitigation
False raid reportsPanic, resource drainMedTrusted-reporter weighting, cooldowns, clustering
Doxxing via reportsSevere harmLowMedAuto-redaction, mod queue, block keywords
Device seizureSevereLowMedLocal clear data, minimal stored PII, passcode decoy
Translation errorMedMedHuman review, glossary, back-translation spot checks
Map reveals vulnerable siteSevereLowCoarse grids, time-boxing, mod approval for sensitive zones

Privacy-Preserving Metrics

  • Counts, not trails: #alerts by zone per day; verification ratios; moderation latency.

  • No user cohorts unless pseudonymous and consented.

  • A/B copy tests only on static KYR pages; never in panic flows.

Hand-Off to DeepSeek (Engineering Tickets)

  1. Client metadata filter: EXIF stripping, face/license blurring (on-device if possible).

  2. Geo-grid snap: 2501000m grid with jitter; PostGIS for clustering.

  3. Retention jobs: Auto-expire unverified after N hours; redact precise timestamps.

  4. Role/RBAC: Public, Trusted, Org, Mod, Admin with least-privilege.

  5. Panic PWA route: Offline bundle + 2-tap exit + data-clear.

  6. SMS gateway: Keyword router (PANIC, KYR, ALERT), rate limiting, templated replies.

  7. Moderation queue: Reason codes, action log, merge/duplicate tooling.

  8. Localization system: i18n files + glossary hooks; reviewer workflow.

  9. Heatmap logic: Confidence-weighted intensity; cooldown per tile.

  10. Audit export: Weekly redacted CSV/JSON for community oversight.

Provide concrete tech choices and a deploy diagram.

  • Integrations: Partner with existing mutual-aid/legal hotlines; we integrate, not replace.

Unit 3 Language Access Justice (SALT)

1) Legal baseline (why this matters)

  • Federal duty to provide language access. Under Executive Order 13166, all federal agencies must take reasonable steps to ensure meaningful access for people with limited English proficiency (LEP) in federally conducted programs. Agencies and federal-funded recipients must have language access plans. Federal RegisterDepartment of Justice

  • DHS/ICE policies. DHS maintains an updated Language Access Plan; DHS Components (incl. ICE) must implement it. ICEs language access program is run by its civil rights office and includes interpretation/translation routes. U.S. Department of Homeland Security+1ICE

  • Detention standards. For people in ICE custody, facilities must provide interpretation (bilingual staff or professional services) and translate key written materials (Spanish at minimum, others as practicable). ICE

  • How to report violations. DHSs Office for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties (CRCL) accepts civil rights complaints (incl. language access). Theres an online portal and a fillable PDF. U.S. Department of Homeland Security+2U.S. Department of Homeland Security+2

Note: Language access the agent must personally speak your language; it does mean the agency must provide effective interpretation/translation so you can understand and be understood (often via phone/video interpreters). EO 13166/Title VI principles are the floor; local policies may provide more. Department of JusticeHHS.gov

2) Handling unidentified agents (kidnapping concern)

We do not recommend physical intervention. Prioritize safety, verification, and documentation:

Verification steps (bystander):

  1. From a safe distance, ask: Please show credentials and a judicial warrant if entering a private space. (ICE administrative forms I-200/I-205 are not judicial warrants and do not authorize entry without consent.) ACLU of Southern CaliforniaThe ACLU of Northern CaliforniaNILC

  2. Call 911 and state: Individuals claiming to be federal agents are detaining someone but refuse to identify; Im requesting verification.

  3. Record what you can without interfering (location, time, vehicle plates, faces blurred if posted). The general right to record officials in public is widely recognized; obey lawful orders not to interfere and any distance/buffer rules in your state. American Civil Liberties UnionJustia LawAP News

  4. If identity cannot be verified and force is used, describe what you see to 911 as a possible abduction; do not physically intervene.

Home entry rule of thumb (SALT copy standard):
Closed door, ask for a judge-signed warrant. Administrative ICE forms arent enough to enter a home. Do not open the door; ask them to slide/hold a warrant for inspection. American Civil Liberties UnionThe ACLU of Northern California

3) What SALT will build (deliverables)

A) Anonymous Language-Access Violation Reporter (web/SMS)

  • Fields: date/time, location (cross streets or grid), agency (ICE/CBP/other), component (ERO/HSI if known), language requested, interpreter provided (Y/N/mode), delay duration, outcome, any adverse action, optional media (with EXIF stripped & face/plate blur).

  • Tags: no interpreter, child interpreter used, documents not translated, detention without access, phone interpreter refused, etc.

  • Routing: high-risk flags mod queue; bulk export CRCL/partner orgs.

B) Plain-Language Quick Card (EN/ES)

Ready for print, app, and SMS menus (below).

C) Complaint Template Pack

  • CRCL complaint template (email/PDF)

  • Optional Title VI complaint guidance for funded entities (e.g., shelters, hospitals interacting with DHS ops). HHS.gov

D) KYR Module: Language Access

Trauma-informed scripts + glossary; available offline in the PWA.

E) Oversight Dashboard (internal)

Heatmap of incidents per ICE field office; median time-to-interpreter; % with written translations; trend lines by language.

4) Quick Card (field-ready, v1)

EN Your Language Rights (U.S. Federal)

  • You have the right to meaningful language access when dealing with federal agencies (including ICE). Ask for a professional interpreter. I need an interpreter in [language]. Department of Justice

  • At home: Do not open the door unless shown a judge-signed warrant. Ask to see it through a window/under the door. Administrative ICE forms (I-200/I-205) are not enough. ACLU of Southern California

  • If agents refuse to identify: Call 911 to verify. Record from a safe distance without interfering. American Civil Liberties Union

  • Do not sign papers without a lawyer.

  • Need to report a language access violation? DHS CRCL complaint: online portal or PDF form. U.S. Department of Homeland Security

ES Sus Derechos de Idioma (EE. UU.)

  • Tiene derecho a acceso lingstico significativo con agencias federales (incluida ICE). Pida un intrprete profesional: Necesito un intrprete en [idioma]. Department of Justice

  • En casa: No abra la puerta sin una orden firmada por un juez. Formularios administrativos de ICE (I-200/I-205) no bastan. ACLU of Southern California

  • Si se niegan a identificarse: Llame al 911 para verificar. Grabe a distancia sin interferir. American Civil Liberties Union

  • No firme documentos sin abogada/o.

  • Para denunciar falta de interpretacin: Queja a DHS-CRCL (portal o formulario PDF). U.S. Department of Homeland Security

5) CRCL Complaint community template (paste-ready)

Subject: Language Access Violation by DHS/ICE [City, State] [Date/Time]
To: CRCL (see online portal or fillable PDF) U.S. Department of Homeland Security

Summary: On [date/time], at [location], [agency/component] interacted with [me / a community member]. We requested interpretation in [language]. Interpreter was not provided / was delayed [X minutes] / officer insisted on family member minor interpreting / written materials not translated. As a result, we could not understand rights/forms/instructions.

Details:

  • Language requested: [ ]

  • Interpreter mode offered: [none / phone / in-person / ad-hoc staff / child/family]

  • If provided, delay length: [ ]

  • Written materials translated: [yes/no]

  • Consequences: [e.g., signed forms without understanding, missed hearing, etc.]

  • Officials names/badge/unit (if known): [ ]

  • Witnesses/recordings: [safely retained / available upon request]

  • Desired remedy: [policy review, staff training, corrective action, record correction, notice to affected individuals]

I declare under penalty of perjury that the foregoing is true and correct to the best of my knowledge.
Name (optional): [ ] / Contact (safe): [ ]

db_py = textwrap.dedent("""
from sqlmodel import SQLModel, create_engine, Session
import os

DATABASE_URL = os.getenv("DATABASE_URL", "sqlite:///./salt.db")
engine = create_engine(DATABASE_URL, echo=False)

def init_db():
    from .models import Report, Alert, KYRItem
    SQLModel.metadata.create_all(engine)

def get_session():
    with Session(engine) as session:
        yield session
""")

models_py = textwrap.dedent("""
from datetime import datetime
from typing import Optional, Dict, Any
from sqlmodel import SQLModel, Field

class Report(SQLModel, table=True):
    id: Optional[int] = Field(default=None, primary_key=True)
    created_at: datetime = Field(default_factory=datetime.utcnow, index=True)
    # Optional contact
    contact_email: Optional[str] = Field(default=None)
    # Location
    latitude: Optional[float] = Field(default=None, index=True)
    longitude: Optional[float] = Field(default=None, index=True)
    radius_m: Optional[int] = Field(default=None)
    # Details
    category: str = Field(index=True, description="checkpoint/raid/sighting/resource/language_access_violation/...")
    description: str
    language: Optional[str] = Field(default="en")
    is_verified: bool = Field(default=False, index=True)
    status: str = Field(default="pending", description="pending/approved/rejected")  # moderation
    # Flexible JSON-style payload for extra fields (stored as JSON string)
    extra_json: Optional[str] = Field(default=None, description="JSON string for extra fields")

class Alert(SQLModel, table=True):
    id: Optional[int] = Field(default=None, primary_key=True)
    created_at: datetime = Field(default_factory=datetime.utcnow, index=True)
    title: str
    message: str
    language: Optional[str] = Field(default="en")
    latitude: Optional[float] = Field(default=None, index=True)
    longitude: Optional[float] = Field(default=None, index=True)
    radius_m: Optional[int] = Field(default=1000)

class KYRItem(SQLModel, table=True):
    id: Optional[int] = Field(default=None, primary_key=True)
    slug: str = Field(index=True, unique=True)
    title: str
    body_markdown: str
    language: str = Field(default="en", index=True)
    jurisdiction: Optional[str] = Field(default=None, index=True)
    version: str = Field(default="1.0")
    updated_at: datetime = Field(default_factory=datetime.utcnow, index=True)
""")

schemas_py = textwrap.dedent("""
from typing import Optional, Dict, Any, List
from pydantic import BaseModel, Field

class GeoQuery(BaseModel):
    latitude: float
    longitude: float
    radius_m: int = Field(default=1000, ge=10, le=100000)

class ReportCreate(BaseModel):
    contact_email: Optional[str] = None
    latitude: Optional[float] = None
    longitude: Optional[float] = None
    radius_m: Optional[int] = 500
    category: str
    description: str
    language: Optional[str] = "en"
    extra: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None

class ReportRead(BaseModel):
    id: int
    category: str
    description: str
    language: Optional[str]
    latitude: Optional[float]
    longitude: Optional[float]
    radius_m: Optional[int]
    status: str
    extra: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None

class AlertCreate(BaseModel):
    title: str
    message: str
    language: Optional[str] = "en"
    latitude: Optional[float] = None
    longitude: Optional[float] = None
    radius_m: Optional[int] = 1000

class AlertRead(BaseModel):
    id: int
    title: str
    message: str
    language: Optional[str]
    latitude: Optional[float]
    longitude: Optional[float]
    radius_m: Optional[int]

class KYRCreate(BaseModel):
    slug: str
    title: str
    body_markdown: str
    language: str = "en"
    jurisdiction: Optional[str] = None
    version: Optional[str] = "1.0"

class KYRRead(BaseModel):
    id: int
    slug: str
    title: str
    body_markdown: str
    language: str
    jurisdiction: Optional[str]
    version: str
""")

reports_router = textwrap.dedent("""
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException
from sqlmodel import select
from ..db import get_session
from ..models import Report
from ..schemas import ReportCreate, ReportRead, GeoQuery
from sqlmodel import Session
from typing import List, Optional, Dict, Any
from math import radians, cos, sin, asin, sqrt
import json

router = APIRouter()

def haversine(lat1, lon1, lat2, lon2):
    R = 6371000
    phi1, phi2 = radians(lat1), radians(lat2)
    dphi = radians(lat2 - lat1)
    dlambda = radians(lon2 - lon1)
    a = sin(dphi/2)**2 + cos(phi1) * cos(phi2) * sin(dlambda/2)**2
    c = 2 * asin(sqrt(a))
    return R * c

@router.post("/", response_model=ReportRead)
def create_report(payload: ReportCreate, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    extra_json = json.dumps(payload.extra) if payload.extra else None
    item = Report(
        contact_email=payload.contact_email,
        latitude=payload.latitude,
        longitude=payload.longitude,
        radius_m=payload.radius_m,
        category=payload.category,
        description=payload.description,
        language=payload.language,
        extra_json=extra_json,
    )
    session.add(item)
    session.commit()
    session.refresh(item)
    extra = json.loads(item.extra_json) if item.extra_json else None
    return ReportRead(
        id=item.id, category=item.category, description=item.description,
        language=item.language, latitude=item.latitude, longitude=item.longitude,
        radius_m=item.radius_m, status=item.status, extra=extra
    )

@router.get("/", response_model=List[ReportRead])
def list_reports(status: Optional[str] = None, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    query = select(Report).order_by(Report.id.desc())
    if status:
        query = query.where(Report.status == status)
    results = session.exec(query).all()
    out = []
    for i in results:
        extra = json.loads(i.extra_json) if i.extra_json else None
        out.append(ReportRead(
            id=i.id, category=i.category, description=i.description, language=i.language,
            latitude=i.latitude, longitude=i.longitude, radius_m=i.radius_m, status=i.status, extra=extra
        ))
    return out

@router.post("/nearby", response_model=List[ReportRead])
def list_reports_nearby(q: GeoQuery, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    results = session.exec(select(Report)).all()
    out = []
    for i in results:
        if i.latitude is not None and i.longitude is not None:
            d = haversine(q.latitude, q.longitude, i.latitude, i.longitude)
            if d <= q.radius_m + (i.radius_m or 0):
                out.append(i)
    out.sort(key=lambda x: x.id, reverse=True)
    data = []
    for i in out:
        extra = json.loads(i.extra_json) if i.extra_json else None
        data.append(ReportRead(
            id=i.id, category=i.category, description=i.description, language=i.language,
            latitude=i.latitude, longitude=i.longitude, radius_m=i.radius_m, status=i.status, extra=extra
        ))
    return data
""")

moderation_router = textwrap.dedent("""
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException
from sqlmodel import select
from sqlmodel import Session
from ..db import get_session
from ..models import Report

router = APIRouter()

@router.post("/reports/{report_id}/approve")
def approve_report(report_id: int, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    item = session.get(Report, report_id)
    if not item:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Not found")
    item.status = "approved"
    item.is_verified = True
    session.add(item)
    session.commit()
    return {"ok": True, "id": item.id, "status": item.status}

@router.post("/reports/{report_id}/reject")
def reject_report(report_id: int, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    item = session.get(Report, report_id)
    if not item:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Not found")
    item.status = "rejected"
    item.is_verified = False
    session.add(item)
    session.commit()
    return {"ok": True, "id": item.id, "status": item.status}
""")

metrics_router = textwrap.dedent("""
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends
from sqlmodel import select
from sqlmodel import Session
from ..db import get_session
from ..models import Report
import json
from collections import Counter, defaultdict

router = APIRouter()

@router.get("/language_access_summary")
def language_access_summary(session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    q = select(Report).where(Report.category == "language_access_violation")
    reports = session.exec(q).all()
    total = len(reports)
    by_language = Counter()
    by_office = Counter()
    modes = Counter()
    for r in reports:
        extra = json.loads(r.extra_json) if r.extra_json else {}
        lang = extra.get("requested_language","unknown")
        by_language[lang] += 1
        office = extra.get("field_office","unknown")
        by_office[office] += 1
        modes[extra.get("interpreter_mode","none")] += 1
    return {
        "total": total,
        "by_language": by_language,
        "by_office": by_office,
        "interpreter_mode": modes,
    }
""")

alerts_router = textwrap.dedent("""
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends
from sqlmodel import select
from ..db import get_session
from ..models import Alert
from ..schemas import AlertCreate, AlertRead, GeoQuery
from sqlmodel import Session
from typing import List
from math import radians, cos, sin, asin, sqrt

router = APIRouter()

def haversine(lat1, lon1, lat2, lon2):
    R = 6371000
    phi1, phi2 = radians(lat1), radians(lat2)
    dphi = radians(lat2 - lat1)
    dlambda = radians(lon2 - lon1)
    a = sin(dphi/2)**2 + cos(phi1) * cos(phi2) * sin(dlambda/2)**2
    c = 2 * asin(sqrt(a))
    return R * c

@router.post("/", response_model=AlertRead)
def create_alert(payload: AlertCreate, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    item = Alert(**payload.dict())
    session.add(item)
    session.commit()
    session.refresh(item)
    return AlertRead(
        id=item.id, title=item.title, message=item.message, language=item.language,
        latitude=item.latitude, longitude=item.longitude, radius_m=item.radius_m
    )

@router.get("/", response_model=List[AlertRead])
def list_alerts(session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    results = session.exec(select(Alert).order_by(Alert.id.desc())).all()
    return [AlertRead(
        id=i.id, title=i.title, message=i.message, language=i.language,
        latitude=i.latitude, longitude=i.longitude, radius_m=i.radius_m
    ) for i in results]

@router.post("/nearby", response_model=List[AlertRead])
def list_alerts_nearby(q: GeoQuery, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    results = session.exec(select(Alert)).all()
    out = []
    for i in results:
        if i.latitude is not None and i.longitude is not None:
            d = haversine(q.latitude, q.longitude, i.latitude, i.longitude)
            if d <= q.radius_m + (i.radius_m or 0):
                out.append(i)
    out.sort(key=lambda x: x.id, reverse=True)
    return [AlertRead(
        id=i.id, title=i.title, message=i.message, language=i.language,
        latitude=i.latitude, longitude=i.longitude, radius_m=i.radius_m
    ) for i in out]
""")

kyr_router = textwrap.dedent("""
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException
from sqlmodel import select
from ..db import get_session
from ..models import KYRItem
from ..schemas import KYRCreate, KYRRead
from sqlmodel import Session
from typing import List

router = APIRouter()

@router.post("/", response_model=KYRRead)
def create_kyr(payload: KYRCreate, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    existing = session.exec(select(KYRItem).where(KYRItem.slug == payload.slug, KYRItem.language == payload.language)).first()
    if existing:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=409, detail="KYR item already exists for this slug/language")
    item = KYRItem(**payload.dict())
    session.add(item)
    session.commit()
    session.refresh(item)
    return KYRRead(**item.dict())

@router.get("/", response_model=List[KYRRead])
def list_kyr(language: str = "en", session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    results = session.exec(select(KYRItem).where(KYRItem.language == language).order_by(KYRItem.updated_at.desc())).all()
    return [KYRRead(**i.dict()) for i in results]

@router.get("/{slug}", response_model=KYRRead)
def get_kyr(slug: str, language: str = "en", session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    item = session.exec(select(KYRItem).where(KYRItem.slug == slug, KYRItem.language == language)).first()
    if not item:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Not found")
    return KYRRead(**item.dict())
""")

QUICK RIGHTS CARD (EN)

 You have the right to meaningful language access with federal agencies. Ask for a professional interpreter: "I need a [Spanish] interpreter, please."
 At home: Do not open the door unless they show a judge-signed warrant. Administrative ICE forms are not enough.
 If they refuse to identify: Call 911 to verify. Record from a safe distance without interfering.
 Do not sign documents without a lawyer.
 Report language-access violations to DHS CRCL.

def get_session():

models_py = """from datetime import datetime
from typing import Optional
from sqlmodel import SQLModel, Field

class Report(SQLModel, table=True):
    id: Optional[int] = Field(default=None, primary_key=True)
    created_at: datetime = Field(default_factory=datetime.utcnow, index=True)
    contact_email: Optional[str] = Field(default=None)
    latitude: Optional[float] = Field(default=None, index=True)
    longitude: Optional[float] = Field(default=None, index=True)
    radius_m: Optional[int] = Field(default=None)
    category: str = Field(index=True, description="checkpoint/raid/sighting/resource/language_access_violation/...")
    description: str
    language: Optional[str] = Field(default="en")
    is_verified: bool = Field(default=False, index=True)
    status: str = Field(default="pending", description="pending/approved/rejected")
    extra_json: Optional[str] = Field(default=None, description="JSON string for extra fields")

class Alert(SQLModel, table=True):
    id: Optional[int] = Field(default=None, primary_key=True)
    created_at: datetime = Field(default_factory=datetime.utcnow, index=True)
    title: str
    message: str
    language: Optional[str] = Field(default="en")
    latitude: Optional[float] = Field(default=None, index=True)
    longitude: Optional[float] = Field(default=None, index=True)
    radius_m: Optional[int] = Field(default=1000)

class KYRItem(SQLModel, table=True):
    id: Optional[int] = Field(default=None, primary_key=True)
    slug: str = Field(index=True, unique=True)
    title: str
    body_markdown: str
    language: str = Field(default="en", index=True)
    jurisdiction: Optional[str] = Field(default=None, index=True)
    version: str = Field(default="1.0")
    updated_at: datetime = Field(default_factory=datetime.utcnow, index=True)"""

    radius_m: Optional[int] = 500
    category: str
    description: str

You said:
Okay, what about the system to, like, flag track them by people reporting?
ChatGPT said:

totally doable. heres the simple, human version of a flag & track by community reports system, built on what we already have.

How it works (plain English)

1) People report what they see

  • Inputs: short web form or SMS (RAID at 7 Mile & Woodward, 6 agents, no Spanish).

  • They never need to give their name.

2) The system cleans the report

  • Strips photo metadata, blurs faces/plates (if media).

  • Snaps the location to a map tile (e.g., ~500m grid) so nobody gets doxxed.

3) It checks for duplicates + patterns

  • Clusters reports that land in the same tile + time window.

  • If 3 people report the same thing in 20 minutes confidence goes up.

  • If a known trusted reporter files it, confidence goes up faster.

4) Moderators see a simple queue

  • Big buttons: Approve / Merge / Mark Rumor / Reject with a reason code.

  • Approving pushes it to the map; Rumor shows, but dimmer and time-limited.

5) The map lights up

  • Tiles color = confidence score (more reports = hotter).

  • Hover shows human words: 3 reports 7:107:35pm No interpreter provided.

6) Automatic alerts (with brakes)

  • If a tile crosses a threshold (e.g., confidence 60) notify subscribers nearby.

  • Built-in cooldown so one incident doesnt spam.

7) Metrics for accountability

  • Count by field office, language denied, operation type.

  • Weekly export for CRCL complaints and press.

Under the hood (in case youre curious)

Confidence score (example)

pgsql
score = 20 * num_reports_in_tile_window
       + 30 if has_trusted_reporter
       + 10 if matching keywords (raid/checkpoint/detention)
       - 20 if older than 2 hours
       - 30 if mod flagged rumor
cap at 100

Deduping window

  • Same tile, within 3060 minutes merged cluster.

  • Older clusters decay so maps dont stay hot forever.

Privacy

  • Grid tiles (not exact addresses), EXIF strip, face/plate blur, short retention for unverified reports.

Abuse controls

  • First-time reporters go to needs review.

  • Rate limits per device/IP, word filters for obvious spam, voucher system for Trusted Reporters.

What you do vs. what the system does

System (I build it):

  • Intake (web/SMS), clustering, scoring, mod queue, map, alerts, metrics, exports.

You / community:

  • Share the link/number to report.

  • Approve/merge a few items in the mod queue (23 people with mod buttons).

  • Decide whos a Trusted Reporter (local orgs, trained volunteers).

  • Use the dashboard to file bulk complaints and brief media.

Where it lives in our app (concrete)

  • /reports already exists we add enforcement_activity type with fields: agents_count?, vehicles_marked?, language_requested?, interpreter_mode?, operation_type? (raid/checkpoint/detention).

  • Scoring & clustering runs server-side; tiles are shown on Live Map page.

  • /moderation endpoints already stubbed add Merge + Rumor actions.

  • /alerts/trigger fires when a tile crosses threshold; SMS/web push goes to subscribers in radius (with cooldown).

  • /metrics shows trends; Export creates a redacted CSV for CRCL.

Two modes (choose based on your energy)

Light Mode (zero tech from you)

  • I ship a downloadable bundle: you open it, copy the report link and share.

  • You (or a friend) click Approve/Merge in the mod queue a few times a day.

  • You read a simple Todays hotspots page and download the CRCL CSV.

Pro Mode (later)

  • Cloud deploy + SMS short code + Trusted Reporter program + full heatmaps.

If you want me to take charge, Ill extend our v0.2 right now with:

  1. the enforcement_activity report type + scoring/cluster logic,

  2. a simple Live Map page with tiles & legends,

  3. Merge/Rumor buttons in the mod queue,

  4. Alert thresholds with a dry-run log (so you can see what would have sent).

Say the word and Ill ship the zip in my next message.

reports_router = textwrap.dedent("""
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends
from sqlmodel import select
from ..db import get_session
from ..models import Report
from ..schemas import ReportCreate, ReportRead, GeoQuery
from sqlmodel import Session
from typing import List, Optional, Dict, Any
from math import radians, cos, sin, asin, sqrt
import json

router = APIRouter()

def haversine(lat1, lon1, lat2, lon2):
    R = 6371000
    phi1, phi2 = radians(lat1), radians(lat2)
    dphi = radians(lat2 - lat1)
    dlambda = radians(lon2 - lon1)
    a = sin(dphi/2)**2 + cos(phi1) * cos(phi2) * sin(dlambda/2)**2
    c = 2 * asin(sqrt(a))
    return R * c

@router.post("/", response_model=ReportRead)
def create_report(payload: ReportCreate, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    extra_json = json.dumps(payload.extra) if payload.extra else None
    item = Report(
        contact_email=payload.contact_email,
        latitude=payload.latitude,
        longitude=payload.longitude,
        radius_m=payload.radius_m,
        category=payload.category,
        description=payload.description,
        language=payload.language,
        extra_json=extra_json,
    )
    session.add(item)
    session.commit()
    session.refresh(item)
    extra = json.loads(item.extra_json) if item.extra_json else None
    return ReportRead(
        id=item.id, category=item.category, description=item.description,
        language=item.language, latitude=item.latitude, longitude=item.longitude,
        radius_m=item.radius_m, status=item.status, extra=extra
    )

@router.get("/", response_model=List[ReportRead])
def list_reports(status: Optional[str] = None, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    query = select(Report).order_by(Report.id.desc())
    if status:
        query = query.where(Report.status == status)
    results = session.exec(query).all()
    out = []
    for i in results:
        extra = json.loads(i.extra_json) if i.extra_json else None
        out.append(ReportRead(
            id=i.id, category=i.category, description=i.description, language=i.language,
            latitude=i.latitude, longitude=i.longitude, radius_m=i.radius_m, status=i.status, extra=extra
        ))
    return out

@router.post("/nearby", response_model=List[ReportRead])
def list_reports_nearby(q: GeoQuery, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    results = session.exec(select(Report)).all()
    out = []
    for i in results:
        if i.latitude is not None and i.longitude is not None:
            d = haversine(q.latitude, q.longitude, i.latitude, i.longitude)
            if d <= q.radius_m + (i.radius_m or 0):
                out.append(i)
    out.sort(key=lambda x: x.id, reverse=True)
    data = []
    for i in out:
        extra = json.loads(i.extra_json) if i.extra_json else None
        data.append(ReportRead(
            id=i.id, category=i.category, description=i.description, language=i.language,
            latitude=i.latitude, longitude=i.longitude, radius_m=i.radius_m, status=i.status, extra=extra
        ))
    return data
""")

moderation_router = textwrap.dedent("""
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException
from sqlmodel import Session
from ..db import get_session
from ..models import Report

router = APIRouter()

@router.post("/reports/{report_id}/approve")
def approve_report(report_id: int, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    item = session.get(Report, report_id)
    if not item:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Not found")
    item.status = "approved"
    item.is_verified = True
    session.add(item)
    session.commit()
    return {"ok": True, "id": item.id, "status": item.status}

@router.post("/reports/{report_id}/reject")
def reject_report(report_id: int, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    item = session.get(Report, report_id)
    if not item:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Not found")
    item.status = "rejected"
    item.is_verified = False
    session.add(item)
    session.commit()
    return {"ok": True, "id": item.id, "status": item.status}
""")

metrics_router = textwrap.dedent("""
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends
from sqlmodel import select, Session
from ..db import get_session
from ..models import Report
import json
from collections import Counter

router = APIRouter()

@router.get("/language_access_summary")
def language_access_summary(session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    q = select(Report).where(Report.category == "language_access_violation", Report.status=="approved")
    reports = session.exec(q).all()
    total = len(reports)
    by_language = Counter()
    modes = Counter()
    for r in reports:
        extra = json.loads(r.extra_json) if r.extra_json else {}
        by_language[extra.get("requested_language","unknown")] += 1
        modes[extra.get("interpreter_mode","none")] += 1
    return {"total": total, "by_language": by_language, "interpreter_mode": modes}
""")

alerts_router = textwrap.dedent("""
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends
from sqlmodel import select, Session
from ..db import get_session
from ..models import Alert
from ..schemas import AlertCreate, AlertRead, GeoQuery
from typing import List
from math import radians, cos, sin, asin, sqrt

router = APIRouter()

def haversine(lat1, lon1, lat2, lon2):
    R = 6371000
    phi1, phi2 = radians(lat1), radians(lat2)
    dphi = radians(lat2 - lat1)
    dlambda = radians(lon2 - lon1)
    a = sin(dphi/2)**2 + cos(phi1) * cos(phi2) * sin(dlambda/2)**2
    c = 2 * asin(sqrt(a))
    return R * c

@router.post("/", response_model=AlertRead)
def create_alert(payload: AlertCreate, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    item = Alert(**payload.dict())
    session.add(item)
    session.commit()
    session.refresh(item)
    return AlertRead(
        id=item.id, title=item.title, message=item.message, language=item.language,
        latitude=item.latitude, longitude=item.longitude, radius_m=item.radius_m
    )

@router.get("/", response_model=List[AlertRead])
def list_alerts(session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    results = session.exec(select(Alert).order_by(Alert.id.desc())).all()
    return [AlertRead(
        id=i.id, title=i.title, message=i.message, language=i.language,
        latitude=i.latitude, longitude=i.longitude, radius_m=i.radius_m
    ) for i in results]

@router.post("/nearby", response_model=List[AlertRead])
def list_alerts_nearby(q: GeoQuery, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    results = session.exec(select(Alert)).all()
    out = []
    for i in results:
        if i.latitude is not None and i.longitude is not None:
            d = haversine(q.latitude, q.longitude, i.latitude, i.longitude)
            if d <= q.radius_m + (i.radius_m or 0):
                out.append(i)
    out.sort(key=lambda x: x.id, reverse=True)
    return [AlertRead(
        id=i.id, title=i.title, message=i.message, language=i.language,
        latitude=i.latitude, longitude=i.longitude, radius_m=i.radius_m
    ) for i in out]
""")

kyr_router = textwrap.dedent("""
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException
from sqlmodel import select, Session
from ..db import get_session
from ..models import KYRItem
from ..schemas import KYRCreate, KYRRead
from typing import List

router = APIRouter()

@router.post("/", response_model=KYRRead)
def create_kyr(payload: KYRCreate, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    existing = session.exec(select(KYRItem).where(KYRItem.slug == payload.slug, KYRItem.language == payload.language)).first()
    if existing:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=409, detail="KYR item already exists for this slug/language")
    item = KYRItem(**payload.dict())
    session.add(item)
    session.commit()
    session.refresh(item)
    return KYRRead(**item.dict())

@router.get("/", response_model=List[KYRRead])
def list_kyr(language: str = "en", session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    results = session.exec(select(KYRItem).where(KYRItem.language == language).order_by(KYRItem.updated_at.desc())).all()
    return [KYRRead(**i.dict()) for i in results]

@router.get("/{slug}", response_model=KYRRead)
def get_kyr(slug: str, language: str = "en", session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    item = session.exec(select(KYRItem).where(KYRItem.slug == slug, KYRItem.language == language)).first()
    if not item:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Not found")
    return KYRRead(**item.dict())
""")

live_router = textwrap.dedent("""
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, Query
from sqlmodel import select, Session
from ..db import get_session
from ..models import Report
import json
from datetime import datetime, timedelta

router = APIRouter()

@router.get("/stream")
def stream_recent_reports(minutes:int=60, category:str="enforcement_activity", session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    # Return approved reports in the last N minutes for the live map
    cutoff = datetime.utcnow() - timedelta(minutes=minutes)
    q = select(Report).where(Report.status=="approved", Report.created_at >= cutoff)
    if category:
        q = q.where(Report.category == category)
    items = session.exec(q).all()
    out = []
    for r in items:
        if r.latitude is None or r.longitude is None:
            continue
        extra = json.loads(r.extra_json) if r.extra_json else {}
        out.append({
            "id": r.id,
            "lat": r.latitude,
            "lng": r.longitude,
            "ts": r.created_at.isoformat() + "Z",
            "category": r.category,
            "desc": r.description,
            "extra": extra
        })
    return {"count": len(out), "items": out}
""")

  </div>

    <span class="pill"> enforcement_activity</span>
    <span class="pill"> language_access_violation</span>
  </div>

<script>
const API = localStorage.getItem('salt_api') || 'http://127.0.0.1:8000';
document.getElementById('api').textContent = API;

// Map
const map = L.map('map').setView([42.3314, -83.0458], 11); // Detroit default
L.tileLayer('https://{s}.tile.openstreetmap.org/{z}/{x}/{y}.png', {maxZoom: 19}).addTo(map);

let markers = new Map();

async function refresh(){
  try{
    const res = await fetch(API + '/live/stream?minutes=180&category=enforcement_activity');
    const data = await res.json();
    const seen = new Set();
    data.items.forEach(it=>{
      const id = it.id;
      seen.add(id);
      if(!markers.has(id)){
        const emoji = '';
        const m = L.marker([it.lat, it.lng]).addTo(map).bindPopup(`${emoji} <b>${it.category}</b><br>${it.desc}<br><small>${it.ts}</small>`);
        markers.set(id,m);
      } else {
        // update popup text if changed
        markers.get(id).setPopupContent(` <b>${it.category}</b><br>${it.desc}<br><small>${it.ts}</small>`);
      }
    });
    // remove stale markers
    [...markers.keys()].forEach(id=>{ if(!seen.has(id)){ map.removeLayer(markers.get(id)); markers.delete(id); }});
  }catch(e){ console.warn(e); }
}

function setAPI(){
  const v = prompt('API base URL', localStorage.getItem('salt_api') || 'http://127.0.0.1:8000');
  if(v){ localStorage.setItem('salt_api', v); location.reload(); }
}

function openForm(){
  const d = prompt('Describe enforcement activity (ex: 6 agents, checkpoint, no Spanish):');
  if(!d) return;
  const lat = prompt('Latitude (e.g., 42.3314)');
  const lng = prompt('Longitude (e.g., -83.0458)');
  if(!lat || !lng) return;
  const payload = {
    category: 'enforcement_activity',
    description: d,
    latitude: Number(lat),
    longitude: Number(lng)
  };
  fetch(API + '/reports/', {method:'POST', headers:{'Content-Type':'application/json'}, body: JSON.stringify(payload)})
    .then(r=>r.json()).then(j=>alert('Submitted. A moderator must approve before it appears on the map.'));
}

setInterval(refresh, 5000);
refresh();
</script>
</body>
</html>
""")

panic_html = textwrap.dedent("""
<!doctype html>
<html><head><meta charset="utf-8"/><meta name="viewport" content="
You said:

ChatGPT said:

Yes what youre describing is exactly doable, and it can be done in a legal way if we structure it right.

Heres how it could work in SALT without crossing legal lines:

1. Live Map Based on Verified Community Reports

  • Tiles, not exact addresses we show approximate zones (e.g., 500m1km grid squares) instead of pinpointing exact houses or people.

  • Time decay reports automatically fade after a set period (e.g., 2 hours) so the map is always showing current or very recent activity.

  • Clustering if multiple people report in the same tile, that tile glows brighter (higher confidence).

2. Real-Time Updates

  • Reports can come from:

    • Web form

    • SMS keyword (RAID with location)

    • Trusted reporters (bypass moderation for speed)

  • Map refreshes every minute with new clusters.

3. Pattern & Movement Analysis

  • The backend can link recent tiles into paths if the timing and distance make sense (e.g., same vehicles spotted in consecutive zones).

  • This allows the system to guess possible direction of movement without showing exact streets.

  • Patterns can be saved for long-term analysis (e.g., They often sweep this neighborhood after hitting that area.).

4. Legal Safety Measures

  • No interference the map is informational for community awareness, not a call to block law enforcement.

  • No personal targeting never post agent names, plates, or identifiable personal info publicly.

  • Public right to record/report relies on the general right to document what you can see/hear in public spaces.

  • Moderation & delay some tiles may have a built-in short delay unless posted by trusted sources, to reduce risk of misinfo.

5. User Experience

  • Map view: shows current high-confidence zones in red/orange, fading to gray over time.

  • List view: Last 10 reports with time, type, and location tile.

  • Filters: type of activity (checkpoint, raid, detention, language access violation).

  • Alerts: optional notification when activity appears within a set radius.

6. Technical Build

Wed extend the SALT MVP to:

  1. Add real-time websocket or polling endpoint for new reports.

  2. Store reports in a geo-tile database with time stamps.

  3. Render map using Leaflet.js or Mapbox GL in the frontend.

  4. Implement movement-linking algorithm for path prediction.

If you want, I can move straight to building this Live Map & tracking system into SALT v0.3 so youd have:

  • The reporting form we already made.

  • A live-updating map.

  • Confidence scoring & clustering.

  • Optional movement pattern arrows.

Do you want me to go ahead and design that as the next build? That way youll actually see how it would look and work.

from sqlmodel import SQLModel, create_engine, Session

models_py = textwrap.dedent("""
from datetime import datetime
from typing import Optional
from sqlmodel import SQLModel, Field

class Report(SQLModel, table=True):
    id: Optional[int] = Field(default=None, primary_key=True)
    created_at: datetime = Field(default_factory=datetime.utcnow, index=True)
    contact_email: Optional[str] = Field(default=None)
    latitude: Optional[float] = Field(default=None, index=True)
    longitude: Optional[float] = Field(default=None, index=True)
    radius_m: Optional[int] = Field(default=None)
    # e.g., 'enforcement_activity', 'language_access_violation'
    category: str = Field(index=True)
    description: str
    language: Optional[str] = Field(default="en")
    is_verified: bool = Field(default=False, index=True)
    status: str = Field(default="pending", description="pending/approved/rejected")
    # Store extra structured fields as JSON string
    extra_json: Optional[str] = Field(default=None)

class Alert(SQLModel, table=True):
    id: Optional[int] = Field(default=None, primary_key=True)
    created_at: datetime = Field(default_factory=datetime.utcnow, index=True)
    title: str
    message: str
    language: Optional[str] = Field(default="en")
    latitude: Optional[float] = Field(default=None, index=True)
    longitude: Optional[float] = Field(default=None, index=True)
    radius_m: Optional[int] = Field(default=1000)

class KYRItem(SQLModel, table=True):
    id: Optional[int] = Field(default=None, primary_key=True)
    slug: str = Field(index=True, unique=True)
    title: str
    body_markdown: str
    language: str = Field(default="en", index=True)
    jurisdiction: Optional[str] = Field(default=None, index=True)
    version: str = Field(default="1.0")
    updated_at: datetime = Field(default_factory=datetime.utcnow, index=True)
""")

from typing import Optional, Dict, Any, List
from pydantic import BaseModel, Field

class GeoQuery(BaseModel):
    latitude: float
    longitude: float
    radius_m: int = Field(default=1000, ge=10, le=100000)

class ReportCreate(BaseModel):
    contact_email: Optional[str] = None
    latitude: Optional[float] = None
    longitude: Optional[float] = None
    radius_m: Optional[int] = 500
    category: str
    description: str
    language: Optional[str] = "en"
    extra: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None

class ReportRead(BaseModel):
    id: int
    category: str
    description: str
    language: Optional[str]
    latitude: Optional[float]
    longitude: Optional[float]
    radius_m: Optional[int]
    status: str
    extra: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None

class AlertCreate(BaseModel):
    title: str
    message: str
    language: Optional[str] = "en"
    latitude: Optional[float] = None
    longitude: Optional[float] = None
    radius_m: Optional[int] = 1000

class AlertRead(BaseModel):
    id: int
    title: str
    message: str
    language: Optional[str]
    latitude: Optional[float]
    longitude: Optional[float]
    radius_m: Optional[int]

class KYRCreate(BaseModel):
    slug: str
    title: str
    body_markdown: str
    language: str = "en"
    jurisdiction: Optional[str] = None
    version: Optional[str] = "1.0"

class KYRRead(BaseModel):

    title: str
    body_markdown: str
    language: str
    jurisdiction: Optional[str]
    version: str

reports_router = textwrap.dedent("""
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends
from sqlmodel import select
from ..db import get_session
from ..models import Report
from ..schemas import ReportCreate, ReportRead, GeoQuery
from sqlmodel import Session
from typing import List, Optional
from math import radians, cos, sin, asin, sqrt
import json

router = APIRouter()

def haversine(lat1, lon1, lat2, lon2):
    R = 6371000
    phi1, phi2 = radians(lat1), radians(lat2)
    dphi = radians(lat2 - lat1)
    dlambda = radians(lon2 - lon1)
    a = sin(dphi/2)**2 + cos(phi1) * cos(phi2) * sin(dlambda/2)**2
    c = 2 * asin(sqrt(a))
    return R * c

@router.post("/", response_model=ReportRead)
def create_report(payload: ReportCreate, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    extra_json = json.dumps(payload.extra) if payload.extra else None
    item = Report(
        contact_email=payload.contact_email,
        latitude=payload.latitude,
        longitude=payload.longitude,
        radius_m=payload.radius_m,
        category=payload.category,
        description=payload.description,
        language=payload.language,
        extra_json=extra_json,
    )
    session.add(item)
    session.commit()
    session.refresh(item)
    extra = json.loads(item.extra_json) if item.extra_json else None
    return ReportRead(
        id=item.id, category=item.category, description=item.description,
        language=item.language, latitude=item.latitude, longitude=item.longitude,
        radius_m=item.radius_m, status=item.status, extra=extra
    )

@router.get("/", response_model=List[ReportRead])
def list_reports(status: Optional[str] = None, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    query = select(Report).order_by(Report.id.desc())
    if status:
        query = query.where(Report.status == status)
    results = session.exec(query).all()
    out = []
    for i in results:
        extra = json.loads(i.extra_json) if i.extra_json else None
        out.append(ReportRead(
            id=i.id, category=i.category, description=i.description, language=i.language,
            latitude=i.latitude, longitude=i.longitude, radius_m=i.radius_m, status=i.status, extra=extra
        ))
    return out

@router.post("/nearby", response_model=List[ReportRead])
def list_reports_nearby(q: GeoQuery, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    results = session.exec(select(Report)).all()
    out = []
    for i in results:
        if i.latitude is not None and i.longitude is not None:
            d = haversine(q.latitude, q.longitude, i.latitude, i.longitude)
            if d <= q.radius_m + (i.radius_m or 0):
                out.append(i)
    out.sort(key=lambda x: x.id, reverse=True)
    data = []
    for i in out:
        extra = json.loads(i.extra_json) if i.extra_json else None
        data.append(ReportRead(
            id=i.id, category=i.category, description=i.description, language=i.language,
            latitude=i.latitude, longitude=i.longitude, radius_m=i.radius_m, status=i.status, extra=extra
        ))
    return data
""")

moderation_router = textwrap.dedent("""
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException
from sqlmodel import Session
from ..db import get_session
from ..models import Report

router = APIRouter()

@router.post("/reports/{report_id}/approve")
def approve_report(report_id: int, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    item = session.get(Report, report_id)
    if not item:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Not found")
    item.status = "approved"
    item.is_verified = True
    session.add(item)
    session.commit()
    return {"ok": True, "id": item.id, "status": item.status}

@router.post("/reports/{report_id}/reject")
def reject_report(report_id: int, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    item = session.get(Report, report_id)
    if not item:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Not found")
    item.status = "rejected"
    item.is_verified = False
    session.add(item)
    session.commit()
    return {"ok": True, "id": item.id, "status": item.status}
""")

metrics_router = textwrap.dedent("""
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends
from sqlmodel import select, Session
from ..db import get_session
from ..models import Report
import json
from collections import Counter

router = APIRouter()

@router.get("/language_access_summary")
def language_access_summary(session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    q = select(Report).where(Report.category == "language_access_violation", Report.status=="approved")
    reports = session.exec(q).all()
    total = len(reports)
    by_language = Counter()
    modes = Counter()
    for r in reports:
        extra = json.loads(r.extra_json) if r.extra_json else {}
        by_language[extra.get("requested_language","unknown")] += 1
        modes[extra.get("interpreter_mode","none")] += 1
    return {"total": total, "by_language": by_language, "interpreter_mode": modes}
""")

kyr_router = textwrap.dedent("""
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException
from sqlmodel import select, Session
from ..db import get_session
from ..models import KYRItem
from ..schemas import KYRCreate, KYRRead
from typing import List

router = APIRouter()

@router.post("/", response_model=KYRRead)
def create_kyr(payload: KYRCreate, session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    existing = session.exec(select(KYRItem).where(KYRItem.slug == payload.slug, KYRItem.language == payload.language)).first()
    if existing:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=409, detail="KYR item already exists for this slug/language")
    item = KYRItem(**payload.dict())
    session.add(item)
    session.commit()
    session.refresh(item)
    return KYRRead(**item.dict())

@router.get("/", response_model=List[KYRRead])
def list_kyr(language: str = "en", session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    results = session.exec(select(KYRItem).where(KYRItem.language == language).order_by(KYRItem.updated_at.desc())).all()
    return [KYRRead(**i.dict()) for i in results]

@router.get("/{slug}", response_model=KYRRead)
def get_kyr(slug: str, language: str = "en", session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    item = session.exec(select(KYRItem).where(KYRItem.slug == slug, KYRItem.language == language)).first()
    if not item:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Not found")
    return KYRRead(**item.dict())
""")

live_router = textwrap.dedent("""
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends
from sqlmodel import select, Session
from ..db import get_session
from ..models import Report
import json
from datetime import datetime, timedelta

router = APIRouter()

@router.get("/stream")
def stream_recent_reports(minutes:int=120, category:str="enforcement_activity", session: Session = Depends(get_session)):
    cutoff = datetime.utcnow() - timedelta(minutes=minutes)
    q = select(Report).where(Report.status=="approved", Report.created_at >= cutoff)
    if category:
        q = q.where(Report.category == category)
    items = session.exec(q).all()
    out = []
    for r in items:
        if r.latitude is None or r.longitude is None:
            continue
        extra = json.loads(r.extra_json) if r.extra_json else {}
        out.append({
            "id": r.id,
            "lat": r.latitude,
            "lng": r.longitude,
            "ts": r.created_at.isoformat() + "Z",
            "category": r.category,
            "desc": r.description,
            "extra": extra
        })
    return {"count": len(out), "items": out}
""")

Live ICE Activity Map How It Works

  1. People Submit Live Reports

    • Using the same SALT reporting form (phone or web), people can select:

      • Type of incident (ICE sighting, active raid, detention, checkpoint, etc.)

      • Location (GPS from phone or manually entered)

      • Time (auto-filled but editable)

      • Optional details (number of agents, uniforms, vehicles, language violations, etc.)

  2. Map Updates in Real Time

    • Every new report appears as a pin on a public map.

    • Color-coded by type of incident (e.g., red = active raid, yellow = checkpoint, blue = ICE sighting).

    • Pins fade over time (e.g., disappear after 48 hours) to keep data fresh.

  3. Pattern & Heatmap View

    • The system automatically detects hotspots where multiple reports cluster.

    • Can show time-of-day patterns for common targeting.

  4. Safety-First Filtering

    • Reports go through quick moderation or trusted reporter status to avoid false reports.

    • Locations are slightly blurred (e.g., by 12 blocks) to avoid pinpointing individuals being targeted.

Legal Position

  • This is similar to how police scanner + citizen-reporting apps (like Waze for traffic cops) work.

  • Youre not interfering youre sharing public sightings and patterns.

  • Data is anonymized for safety.

from fastapi import FastAPI
from fastapi.middleware.cors import CORSMiddleware
from .routers import reports, alerts, kyr, moderation, metrics, live

app = FastAPI(
    title="SALT API",
    version="0.3.0",
    description="SALT MVP with Language Access, Moderation, Metrics, and a Live Map feed"

app.add_middleware(
    CORSMiddleware,
    allow_origins=["*"],

    allow_methods=["*"],
    allow_headers=["*"],

app.include_router(metrics.router, prefix="/metrics", tags=["metrics"])
app.include_router(live.router, prefix="/live", tags=["live"])

@app.get("/", tags=["meta"])
def root():
    return {"ok": True, "name": "SALT API", "version": "0.3.0"}
